Description: To resolve a Clean Air Act case, Coffeyville Resources Refining and Marketing, LLC and Coffeyville Resources Terminal agreed to spend $22 million to reduce emissions of volatile organic compounds, particulate matter and benzene.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2004/March/04_enrd_140.htm

Agency: Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration
Info Source: http://primis.phmsa.dot.gov/comm/reports/enforce/CaseDetail_cpf_320125010.html?nocache=1092

Description: Coffeyville Resources Refining & Marketing agreed to pay a civil penalty of more than $970,000 and invest more than $4.25 million in new pollution controls and $6.5 million in operating costs to resolve alleged violations of air, Superfund and community right-to-know laws at its Coffeyville, Kan., refinery, announced the Department of Justice and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/kansas-refinery-pay-nearly-1-million-penalty-environmental-violations-related-air-emissions

Description: Coffeyville Resources Refining & Marketing agreed to pay a $556,244 civil penalty to settle alleged violations of the Clean Water Act at its facility in Coffeyville, Kansas, the Environmental Protection Agency announced. In addition to paying the penalty, CRRM will pay $1,746,256 for reimbursement of federal response costs associated with the cleanup of the Verdigris River following a 2007 flood and oil spill.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/caf788c198308f9d85257b1000795325.html

Description: Coffeyville Resources Refining & Marketing (CRRM) has agreed to pay a $300,000 civil penalty to settle alleged violations of the Clean Air Act (CAA) at its oil refinery in Coffeyville, Kan.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/c991999b08f14cdb85257b730056a2b5.html

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The Pep Boys - Manny, Moe & Jack - agreed to pay $5 million in civil penalties and take corrective measures to settle claims that it violated the Clean Air Act by importing and selling motorcycles, recreational vehicles and generators manufactured in China that do not comply with environmental requirements.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department
Info Source: http://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/pep-boys-agrees-pay-5-million-resolve-clean-air-act-violations-claims
